title: Perspectives on Monetary Policy
content: Bord of Governors of the Federal Reserve System    7   June 6, 2012                                 Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System                                                         7   Behavior of Inflation and Unemployment      • Does the stability of inflation in the face of high  unemployment mean that unemployment is  structural, not cyclical?     • Simple Phillips curve model predicts downward  pressure on inflation from labor market slack.    • But cross country evidence shows that once  inflation is low, it is less responsive to slack.     • This nonlinearity may reflect downward  nominal wage rigidity.
